At any point in time, programs tend to access a set of active virtual pages called the working set â€¢ Programs with better temporal locality will have smaller working sets
If (working set size < main memory size) â€¢ Good performance for one process after compulsory misses
If ( SUM(working set sizes) > main memory size ) â€¢ Thrashing: Performance meltdown where pages are swapped (copied) in and out continuously locality issue.

Rule 1: If Priority(A) > Priority(B), A runs (B doesn't). Rule 2: If Priority(A) = Priority(B), A & B run in RR. Rule 3: When a job enters the system, it is placed at the highest priority. Rule 4: Once a job uses up its time allotment at a given level (regardless of how many times it has given up the CPU), its priority is reduced (i.e., it moves down on queue). Rule 5: After some time period S, move all the jobs in the system to the topmost queue.

Bipartite graph : A graph which vertices can be divided into 2 groups, and the vertices held in the same group are not connected.

[3] Design Thinking Process : Non-Linear, Iterative process

(Need) to meet actual users. < You are not the customer (designer ego loss) > Employee view observation interview observe, engage, watch and listen use affected or influenced observe + engage: request to perform steps + vocalize Primary / Secondary USERS

â¢ Field Studies: In their context / Controlled studies: Controlled settings their context video recording- performance logging, +interact Contextual Inquiry: master / Apprentice model but good for regular <-> not for rare â¢ Empathy Map â¢ Diary Studies: Need easy capture tools <log> â¢ Survey: easy to recruit / progress update â¢ Task analysis - Trigger, Desired outcome, Base Knowledge, Required Knowledge, Artifacts - Identify -> break-down -> Collect data -> draw -> tools

Interview -> do not have too clear of problem space. / UI/UX -> Structured Interview, semi-structured Interview (call Interview) pre-determined drive - Interview -> Pros : deep / open-ended / more contextual -> Cons : Time-consuming / overwhelming amount of data / biased - Transcription -> need representative user, broader questions, more break-down questions (answerable) prioritized open-ended questions DO NOT : How often, how much from 1-10, predictable, leading, what they will do with new ~ , hypothetical questions new feature -> Introduction / warm up / main body / wrap up
